API: HttpServletResponse
CODE:
```java
@RequestMapping(value = "/download", method = RequestMethod.GET)
public void downloadPdf(HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException {
    response.setContentType("application/pdf");
    response.setHeader("Content-Disposition", "attachment; filename=\"your_file_name.pdf\"");

    // Generate your PDF here using iText or any other PDF generation library
    // ...

    byte[] bytes = "Your PDF content as a string".getBytes();
    response.getOutputStream().write(bytes);
}
```

EXPLANATION: This code will allow the user to download a PDF file. The PDF content is generated within the code using iText or any other PDF generation library. The response is set to indicate that the content is a PDF file and to prompt the user to download it. The PDF content is written to the output stream of the response.

Note: The PDF content in this example is a string. In a real-world scenario, you would generate the PDF content using your PDF generation library and convert it to a byte array.

Also, ensure that you handle exceptions properly in your code. This example does not include exception handling for simplicity.

This code should be placed in a Spring Controller.

Please note that the actual PDF generation code is not included in this example. You would need to use a PDF generation library like iText or Apache PDFBox to generate the PDF content.

This code will work if you have a Spring Boot application with a controller that handles HTTP GET requests at the "/download" path.

Please replace "your_file_name.pdf" with the actual name you want to give to the downloaded file.

This code will allow the user to download a PDF file from your Spring Boot application.
